text:
Sadashiv Amarapurkar (born Ganesh Kumar Nalawade; 2 January 1950 – 3 November 2014) was an Indian actor. He was well known for his roles in Marathi and Hindi movies in the 1980s and 90s.
He won the Filmfare Award for Best Performance in a Negative Role in 1991 for "Sadak" — the first time the award was instituted. In addition to negative roles, he has done supporting roles and, more recently, comic roles.
Amarapurkar died in Mumbai, India from a lung infection, aged 64.
